articles.description: New COVID-19 hospitalizations have been rising through the end of summer, after falling steadily week after week since January.
articles.content:
The five states with the highest rates of COVID-19 test positivity have seen a fall in numbers, latest official data shows, amid a growing backlash about potential mask mandates.

articles.author: Gretchen Reynolds
articles.title: 'Weekend warriors' get heart benefits from just a few days of exercise - The Washington Post
articles.description: People who jammed almost all of their exercise into the weekends were much less likely to develop heart problems than people who rarely exercised.
articles.content:

If you were too busy working this week to work out, a new study has cheery news.

articles.title: As patients suffer, long COVID remains a collection of symptoms with no single cure - The Times of Israel
articles.description: With COVID wards and post-COVID clinics in hospitals now closed, the 10-20% of COVID sufferers who have long-term debilitating condition seek help through community health services

articles.title: Night owls are more likely to develop diabetes than early birds, new research shows - USA TODAY
